TopicTitle: Kerbal/Kerbin (whatever they're called) floating away from ship, jetpack not working!

Articles.Content: Newbie here. How do I work the jetpack feature? I pressed W, A, S, D, Q, and E and they did nothing. I dismounted the ladder and started slowly flying away. (This is the best, closest I've ever gotten to landing on the moon. Once I was about 10 Kerbal-creature person thing-lengths away (I'd say like 5-10 meters) I freaked out and went back to the space center then closed the game. It's still there in that format. Please help me get Jebadiah back to safety , I have no idea what to do D:
You lost JEB?! Ok there is a infinite eva fuel option. If you press CTRL+ALT+SHIFT+D you will get a debug panel and there is a infinite EVA fuel option. and oh yea, press R to activate jetpack lol
My wife claim they are "Kerblings" and not "Kerbals" ... and i must say, "Kerblings" really sounds good, and "tastes good"

Of course I find out about this now. Missed it when I looked at the controls on the wiki.

My first Kerbal to enter Kerbol orbit decided to step out of his capsule after 50 days. I accidentally told him to let go, and he sloooooowly fell away from the capsule over the course of the next two weeks. Somehow he made it back in time for the next launch, even though his old capsule still orbits Kerbol.

Kerbol = The Star

Kerbin = The planet

Kerbal = Of or having to do with Kerbin

Kerman = Inhabitant of Kerbin

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
Thanks! I didn't know to press "R" lol.
I thought that Kerman was the clan of Kerbals with a preference for spaceflight?

I thought that Kerman was the clan of Kerbals with a preference for spaceflight?

Nah, Kerman is just the same as 'human'.

Isn't Kerman just a surname?!?

everybody out there is always saying "kerbal" or "kerbals"

Nah, Kerman is just the same as 'human'.

Plural form being 'Kermans', then, not 'Kermen'?

Speaking of which, why is 'humans' the plural form of 'human', rather than 'humen'?

Kerman = Inhabitant of Kerbin

This I did not know' date=' I thought it was Kerbals!

I thought that Kerman was the clan of Kerbals with a preference for spaceflight?

That what I thought too. And that their cavalier approach to space ship design had wiped out the other clans!
Well if everyone thought it was kerbals and not kermen, then it's kerbals. Language is a matter of consensus anyways (unless your French)

Language is a matter of consensus anyways (unless your French)

*did not understand*

I tend to say Kerbals, I always thought Kerman was more like a family name (or clan, or whatever) (and it would feel strange to add 'Kerman' at the end of each of their names if it was just like 'human').

(and it would feel strange to add 'Kerman' at the end of each of their names if it was just like 'human').

Yes, that seems odd.

So it would be; Bob Human, Bill Human and Jebediah Human?

Does all naming have to follow the K rule? After all we are Humans from Earth, we're not Earthians or Earthans, I know that works with Mars -> Martians, but this is exactly why linguists and computer-scientists don't mix well at parties. Language rules don't always scale as you want them to!

[in other news - A tragic accident occurred when several inhabitants of the planet Pluto where loaded into a Nuclear reactor due to a naming error. The Plutonians are furious]
"Kerbal" is also an adjective that means shoddily constructed and gloriously overpowered.

Controls for EVA while grabbing ship:

F: Grab on ship/board (cannot grab while jetpack is in use)

Space: Let go

W: Move up

S: Move down

Controls for jetpack EVA:

R: Activate jetpack

SHIFT: Go up

CTRL: Go down

W: Translate forward

S: Translate backward

A: Translate to the left (though it was for rotating, no it's not)

D: Translate to the right

Walking on the ship is pretty glitchy since I've tried to do it and the Kerbal just acted like it was falling and I couldn't control it. So don't EVA on top of your ship if you only have 1 crew member.

Edited August 24, 2012 by longbyte1
Edited rotation, A and D are actually for translation
